body_html:
I am running into the same problem. I'm running the ps on one machine and have workers running on 4 other machines.

Checkpoints seem to be saved without a problem, but if I try to use SavedModelBuilder at the end, then I get errors. Also, I am worried about using the sess.graph._unsafe_unfinalize() trick because it says "unsafe" in the method name and looks like it is a private method.

Is there any update to this? Maybe an example of the TF-approved approach to saving models in distributed TF?

Thanks.

Checkpoints seem to be saved without a problem, but if I try to use SavedModelBuilder at the end, then I get errors.  Also, I am worried about using the sess.graph._unsafe_unfinalize() trick because it says "unsafe" in the method name and looks like it is a private method.
Is there any update to this? Maybe an example of the TF-approved approach to saving models in distributed TF?
Thanks.
body:
I am running into the same problem. I'm running the ps on one machine and have workers running on  4 other machines.

Checkpoints seem to be saved without a problem, but if I try to use SavedModelBuilder at the end, then I get errors.  Also, I am worried about using the `sess.graph._unsafe_unfinalize()` trick because it says "unsafe" in the method name and looks like it is a private method.

Is there any update to this? Maybe an example of the TF-approved approach to saving models in distributed TF?

Thanks.
